duties_responsibilities.duty: Performs a variety of basic laboratory functions including specimen processing, blood collection, customer service, and data entry procedures in support of the hospital's mission of patient care.
Follows standard operating procedures to process all specimen types to produce accurate results.
Operates laboratory equipment (e.g., centrifuges, timers, computer system, tube transport system), consistent with standard operating procedures.
Restocks the work area with needed supplies, logs in and stores specimens, and delivers specimens into laboratories.
Collects blood and urine specimens from all patients regardless of diagnosis or age, examines and accepts only properly collected and labeled specimens for testing.
Utilizes time, materials, and resources in an economical manner, minimizing waste and promptly processing patient specimens.
Completes computer entry of all requested laboratory tests and sorts and prepares patient reports for distribution.
Participates in educational endeavors of the institution to meet the needs of the specimen processing, laboratory, hospital, and phlebotomy service, and the university.

Displays initiative and responsibility for self-development by attending in services and impromptu consultations, and participates in the training and evaluation of new employees as established by laboratory policies.
